article.headline: SMU 64, Memphis 58
article.story: DALLAS -- Papa Dia finished with 22 points and 10 rebounds as SMU rallied to defeat Memphis 64-58 Wednesday night. Robert Nyakundi and Collin Mangrum each added 15 points for the Mustangs (10-6, 1-1 Conference USA), who beat the Tigers in Dallas for the second straight year. Last season SMU ended Memphis' 27-game road winning streak within the conference. Joe Jackson scored 15 points and Wesley Witherspoon had 11 for the Tigers (12-4, 1-1). The Mustangs trailed by 14 in the first half and were down 48-37 after Tarik Black's dunk with 11:18 to play. SMU then rallied with 17 unanswered points, including six from Dia, and led the rest of the way. Memphis didn't score again until 2:14 remained. The Mustangs were 6 of 9 from 3-point range and scored 28 points off 18 Memphis turnovers.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
